cab.content: .. \ From Secretary of State to Viceroy, Foreign Department,loth June 1920.P. 4508. Following telegram from consul-rGeueral, .Vladivostok, dated 22ndj - " Czecho-Slovak Minister requests that Government of India give all possible assistance to scientific Mission of four persons headed by Professor Hribek leaving Vladivostock shortly for Bombay on the way to Turkestan. Objects of Mission are economical and commercial, and also to get into touch with Czechs cut off in Russian Central Asia by Bolshevik, movement. They propose to proceed via Afghanistan or Chitral, but I have warned them that this is likely to be impossible, and that best route will be. by Persia."Foreign Office ask that you will arrange for such facilities as you may consider,, desirable. ,
